what: A R-Toolkit for Agroclimatic Data Management and Crop Model File Creation

title: Write AquaCrop Weather File — ETo_cal
text: Function compute weather information AquaCrop v6.0  weather file.

title: Write AquaCrop Weather File — ETo_cal
code: ETo_cal(wth_data, lat, elev, ref_ht = 2, kRs = 0.175, ws_mean = 2)

title: Write AquaCrop Weather File — ETo_cal
text: wth_data Data frame Weather data. minimum = date, tmax, tmin, rain elev Numeric. Elevation (meters sea level) kRs Numeric. Hargreaves empirical coefficient, Coastal coefficient ws_mean Numeric. Wind Speed Mean, default = 2 m/s lon Numeric. Longitude (decimal degrees)

title: Write AquaCrop Weather File — ETo_cal
text: function returns Numeric ET0 values (mm).

title: Write AquaCrop Weather File — ETo_cal
code: # Write file ETo_cal(wth_data = weather, lat = 3.8, elev = 650) #> Loading required package: sirad #> No data to calculate ETo!. #> Error in ETo_cal(wth_data = weather, lat = 3.8, elev = 650): object 'ETo' not found

what: agroclimR: A R-Toolkit for Agroclimatic Data Management and Crop Model File Creation — agroclimR
title: agroclimR: A R-Toolkit for Agroclimatic Data Management and Crop Model File Creation — agroclimR
text: agroclimR package designed streamline management,manipulation, generation process-based model files systems like DSSAT v 4.8, ORYZA v3.0, Aquacrop v6.0.

title: agroclimR: A R-Toolkit for Agroclimatic Data Management and Crop Model File Creation — agroclimR
text: Jeferson Rodriguez-Espinoza jrodriguezespinoza@outlook.com

title: ) — run_drates_param
) — run_drates_param
Observed Weather Data — weather
text: dataset containing observed weather data.

title: Observed Weather Data — weather
Observed Weather Data — weather
text: data frame 1461 rows 6 columns DATE Date values -  Daily dates TMAX Numeric values, max temperaturein oC TMIN Numeric values, min temperature oC RAIN Numeric values, precipitation mm d-1 SRAD Numeric values, irradiance MJ m-2 d-1 RHUM Numeric values, relative humidity %

title: Observed Weather Data — weather
text: FEDEARROZ-FNA

what: Write DSSAT v4.8 Soil File — write_soil_dssat
title: Write DSSAT v4.8 Soil File — write_soil_dssat
text: Function compute Soil information DSSAT v4.8 soil file.

title: Write DSSAT v4.8 Soil File — write_soil_dssat
code: write_soil_dssat(   path,   id_name,   soil_data,   salb = 0.13,   evapL = 6,   sldr = 0.6,   slnf = 1,   slpf = 1,   multi = F )

title: Write DSSAT v4.8 Soil File — write_soil_dssat
text: path string indicating path folder working directory id_name String. 4 letters string locality name. (ex. "JR") soil_data Data frame. Soil data. see soil salb Numeric. Albedo, fraction evapL Numeric. Evaporation limit, (mm) slnf Numeric. Mineralization factor, 0 1 scale. slpf Numeric. Photosynthesis factor, 0 1 scale multi Logical. Soil annual average temperature first layers max_depth description

title: Write DSSAT v4.8 Soil File — write_soil_dssat
text: function returns logical files created path folder.

title: Write DSSAT v4.8 Soil File — write_soil_dssat
code: # Write DSSAT v4.8 Soil file soil = group_by(soil, NL) %>% sample_n(1) #> Error in group_by(soil, NL) %>% sample_n(1): could not find function "%>%" write_soil_dssat(id_name = "test_soil", soil_data = soil) #> Minimun data are available #> Error in write_soil_dssat(id_name = "test_soil", soil_data = soil): argument "path" is missing, with no default

what: Write ORYZA v3 Soil File — write_soil_oryza
title: Write ORYZA v3 Soil File — write_soil_oryza
text: Function compute Soil information ORYZA soil file.

title: Write ORYZA v3 Soil File — write_soil_oryza
code: write_soil_oryza(   path = ".",   id_name,   soil_data,   ZRTMS = 0.5,   WL0I = 0,   WCLI = "FC",   RIWCLI = "NO",   SATAV = 20 )

title: Write ORYZA v3 Soil File — write_soil_oryza
text: path string indicating path folder working directory id_name String 4 letters string locality name. "AIHU" = Aipe, Huila soil_data Data frame. Soil data. see soil ZRTMS Numeric. Maximum rooting depth soil (m) WL0I Numeric. Initial pounded water depth start simulation (mm) WCLI Numeric/String. WCLI can take 3 values: Field Capacity ('FC'), 50% Soil Saturation ('ST50'), Fraction water content ('0.0'- '1.0') RIWCLI String. Re-initialize switch RIWCLI ('YES') ('') SATAV Numeric. Soil annual average temperature first layers

title: Write ORYZA v3 Soil File — write_soil_oryza
text: function returns logical files created path folder.

title: Write ORYZA v3 Soil File — write_soil_oryza
code: # Write ORYZA Soil file soil = group_by(soil, NL) %>% sample_n(1) #> Error in group_by(soil, NL) %>% sample_n(1): could not find function "%>%" write_soil_oryza(id_name = "test_soil", soil_data = soil) #> [1] TRUE

title: Write AquaCrop Weather File — write_wth_aquacrop
text: Function compute weather information AquaCrop v6.0  weather file.

title: Write AquaCrop Weather File — write_wth_aquacrop
code: write_wth_aquacrop(   path,   id_name,   wth_data,   lat,   lon,   elev,   co2_file = "MaunaLoa.CO2",   ... )

title: Write AquaCrop Weather File — write_wth_aquacrop
text: path string indicating path folder working directory id_name String. 4 letters string locality name. "AIHU" = Aipe, Huila wth_data Data frame Weather data. minimum = date, tmax, tmin, rain lat Numeric. Latitude (decimal degrees) lon Numeric. Longitude (decimal degrees) elev Numeric. Elevation (meters sea level) co2_file String. Default "MaunaLoa.CO2".  *.CO2 files available Aquacrop default DB

title: Write AquaCrop Weather File — write_wth_aquacrop
text: function returns logical files created path folder.

title: Write AquaCrop Weather File — write_wth_aquacrop
code: # Write file write_wth_aquacrop(   path = ".", id_name = "TEST", wth_data = weather,   lat = 3.8, lon = -76.5, elev = 650) #> Wind Speed = 2m/s was used #> Reference evapotranspiration (ETo) Method: FAO Penman-Monteith equation  +  Assumption: Wind Speed mean = 2m/s #> [1] TRUE

what: Write DSSAT v4.8 Weather File — write_wth_dssat
title: Write DSSAT v4.8 Weather File — write_wth_dssat
text: Function compute weather information DSSAT v4.8 weather file.

title: Write DSSAT v4.8 Weather File — write_wth_dssat
code: write_wth_dssat(path, id_name, wth_data, lat, lon, elev, ref_ht = 2)

title: Write DSSAT v4.8 Weather File — write_wth_dssat
text: path string indicating path folder working directory id_name String 4 letters string locality name. "AIHU" = Aipe, Huila wth_data Data frame Weather data. minimum = date, tmax, tmin, rain lat Numeric. Latitude (decimal degrees) lon Numeric. Longitude (decimal degrees) elev Numeric. Elevation (meters sea level) ref_ht Numeric. Reference height (meters)- weather station

title: Write DSSAT v4.8 Weather File — write_wth_dssat
text: function returns logical files created path folder.

title: Write DSSAT v4.8 Weather File — write_wth_dssat
code: # Write file write_wth_dssat(   path = ".", id_name = "TEST", wth_data = weather,   lat = 3.91, lon = -75.0, elev = 450) #> [1] TRUE

what: Write ORYZA v3 Weather File — write_wth_oryza
title: Write ORYZA v3 Weather File — write_wth_oryza
text: Function compute weather information ORYZA weather file.

title: Write ORYZA v3 Weather File — write_wth_oryza
code: write_wth_oryza(   path = ".",   id_name,   wth_data,   lat,   lon,   elev,   stn = 1,   multiyear = F,   tag = F )

title: Write ORYZA v3 Weather File — write_wth_oryza
text: path string indicating path folder working directory id_name String 4 letters string locality name. "AIHU" = Aipe, Huila wth_data Data frame Weather data. minimum = date, tmax, tmin, rain lat Numeric. Latitude (decimal degrees) lon Numeric. Longitude (decimal degrees) elev Numeric. Elevation (meters sea level) stn Integer. Station number multiyear Logical. TRUE = ".cli" multiyear format FALSE = yearly format (ie. 1998 = *.998) tag Logical. TRUE = write information file

title: Write ORYZA v3 Weather File — write_wth_oryza
text: function returns logical files created path folder.

title: Write ORYZA v3 Weather File — write_wth_oryza
code: # Write file write_wth_oryza(   path = ".", id_name = "TEST", wth_data = weather,   lat = 3.8, lon = -76.5, elev = 650) #> Early morning vapor pressure (VP; kPa) derived from relative humidity data #> Wind Speed is not Available - Set as NA: -99 #> [1] TRUE  write_wth_oryza(   path = ".", id_name = "TEST2", wth_data = weather,   lat = 3.8, lon = -76.5, elev = 650, multiyear = T, tag = T) #> Early morning vapor pressure (VP; kPa) derived from relative humidity data #> Wind Speed is not Available - Set as NA: -99 #> [1] TRUE
